alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 05 at 6:50PM CST until March 06 at 9:15AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Sulphur River Near Talco affecting Morris, Titus, Red River and Franklin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Sulphur River Near Talco. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of the heavily wooded floodplain. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the river bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 20.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM CST Sunday was 22.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 10.3 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 915 AM CST.
